metadata.Title: CVE-2012-4048 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The PPP dissector in Wireshark 1.4.x before 1.4.14, 1.6.x before 1.6.9, and1.8.x before 1.8.1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(invalid pointer dereference and application crash) via a crafted packet,as demonstrated by a usbmon dump.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4048` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.6-1
libwireshark11 - 1.10.6-1
libwiretap8 - 1.10.6-1
libwscodecs2 - 1.10.6-1
libwsutil9 - 1.10.6-1
tshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-common - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-gtk - 1.10.6-1
wireshark-qt - 1.10.6-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wireshark package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.6-1').
